item.title: Mac OS X go likes gcc 4.2.1 doesn't lke 4.7.2
item.dc:creator: T. Kurt Bond
item.description: I have gcc from MacPorts (“gcc version 4.7.2 (MacPorts gcc47 4.7.2_2)”) installed on my laptop running Mac OS X 10.6.8, and when updated and recompiled go the tests failed in the race detector with a message about a MachO segment being missing. I put /usr/bin/gcc at the front of the path, and everything compiled tested fine.

item.title: oo2c on Mac OS X Snow Leopard
item.dc:creator: T. Kurt Bond
item.description:
It looks like I got oo2c to build and work under Mac OS X Snow Leopard, with some stupid hacks, at least enough for my purposes. I don't claim that this is suitable for production work.

Here's the configure invocation I used:

CFLAGS='-no-cpp-precomp -fnested-functions -I/opt/local/include' \
LDFLAGS='-L/opt/local/lib' \
    ./configure --prefix=/sw/versions/m64/oo2c/2.1.11 --disable-libs

Here's the patch.
